meta_description: The Purdue Northwest Gabis Arboretum is a living laboratory for education, research, conservation and engaging the natural environment.
hours_text:
[Purdue University Northwest](https://www.pnw.edu "Go to Purdue University Northwest.") > [Gabis Arboretum](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum "Go to Gabis Arboretum.") > Plan Your Visit

# Plan Your Visit

Plan your visit to the Purdue University Northwest Gabis Arboretum! Find details about admission, Gabis hours and directions, group and field-trip visits and virtual experiences.

Hours Admission

Hours

The arboretum is open daily from 8 a.m. to sunset CST.

**The model trains at the[Railway Garden](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/explore-gabis/gardens/railway-garden/) are done running for the season.**

[See Hours & Admission Details](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/plan-your-visit/hours/)

Admission

Daily admission for non-members is $10 per carload. **Additional fees apply for access to the[Railway Garden](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/explore-gabis/gardens/railway-garden/) when trains are running.**

Special pricing exists for PNW students, minibuses, tour buses and others.

### PLEASE NOTE: Gate payment is credit card only.

[See Hours & Admission Details](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/plan-your-visit/hours/)

[See Gabis Arboretum Trail Map](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/wp-content/uploads/sites/72/2020/06/Gabis-Arboretum-Map.pdf)

## Directions

Located between Valparaiso and Merrillville, Indiana, Gabis Arboretum is open daily.

[Get Directions to Gabis](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/plan-your-visit/directions/)

admission_text:
[Purdue University Northwest](https://www.pnw.edu "Go to Purdue University Northwest.") > [Gabis Arboretum](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum "Go to Gabis Arboretum.") > [Plan Your Visit](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/plan-your-visit/ "Go to Plan Your Visit.") > Hours & Admission Fees

# Hours & Admission Fees

Ready to visit the Purdue University Northwest Gabis Arboretum? See hours and admission fees.

**The model trains at the[Railway Garden](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/explore-gabis/gardens/railway-garden/) run Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from May through October, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.**

## Hours

Arboretum Grounds Railway Garden

Arboretum Grounds

Daily 8 a.m. to Sunset CST

**Member Early Access:** Gabis Arboretum Members have access to the arboretum grounds beginning at sunrise from April to November only. Members should bring their membership card to scan upon entry. Facilities will continue to open at 8 a.m.

Railway Garden

**The Railway Garden is open for viewing from May 1 to October 31 daily.**

Model Trains

The model trains run on Friday through Sunday from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. only.

The model trains cannot run in unfavorable weather conditions such as wind, rain, and extremely hot weather.

Please call ahead to confirm (219) 462-0025.

## Admission Fees

 _General admission fees may not include special event or educational program access. See individual event or program for details._

[See Automated Gate Access Details](https://www.pnw.edu/new-f...
accessibility_text:
[Purdue University Northwest](https://www.pnw.edu "Go to Purdue University Northwest.") > [Office for Civil Rights](https://www.pnw.edu/office-civil-rights "Go to Office for Civil Rights.") > Accessibility

# Accessibility

PNW is committed to providing equal access to employment opportunities, educational programs, services, activities and events.

The Office for Civil Rights provides reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities, facilitates accommodations for university-sponsored events and responds to campus accessibility concerns.

## Accommodation Overview

A reasonable accommodation is a modification or adjustment to a process or environment which removes barriers. In the workplace, a reasonable accommodation will enable a qualified person with a disability to enjoy equal employment opportunities and perform the essential functions of their job.

### Employee Accommodations

If you are an employee with a disability and need a workplace accommodation, please:

Review the Process for Requesting Workplace Accommodations

  1. Employee requests reasonable accommodation(s) under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA) and the ADA Amendments Act of 2008 (ADAAA). To initiate the process, employee contacts Tim Griffin, Associate Director for Civil Rights, (219) 989-2163, timothyg@pnw.edu

  2. Employee meets with the Associate Director at respective campus. During this meeting the following will occur:
     * The Associate Director explains the i...
collections_text:
#  Gabis Arboretum

[ ](https://www.facebook.com/GabisArboretum/) [ ](https://twitter.com/gabis_arboretum) [ ](https://www.instagram.com/gabisarboretum/)

Gabis Arboretum

The Purdue University Northwest Gabis Arboretum serves as a living laboratory for education, research, conservation and engagement with the natural environment.

## Model Trains Done for Season

**The model trains at the[Railway Garden](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/explore-gabis/gardens/railway-garden/) have stopped running for the season. They will resume operation in May.**

## Explore Gabis

Gabis Arboretum boasts 300 acres of magnificent landscapes featuring a restored prairie, display gardens, wetlands and miles of hiking trails through woodlands. With musical events and public educational programs, the arboretum has something for any interest!

[Explore Gabis Arboretum](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/explore/)

[PLAN YOUR GABIS VISIT](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/plan-your-visit/)

## Purchase a Gift Membership

Treat a loved one to a Gabis Arboretum gift membership! They will enjoy special benefits and the pleasure of helping to protect 300 acres of green space.

[See Gift Membership Details](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/get-involved/become-a-member/gift-membership/)

## Resources

[Become a Member](https://www.pnw.edu/gabis-arboretum/get-involved/become-a-member/)

A Gabis Arboretum provides free admission and reciprocal benefits to more than 300 other arboreta and gardens ...
